head.supplied: 1/3/69. ¶ ¶ It is very kind of you, dear Mr Manners-Sutton, to inform me of his Excellency's friendly intention, to forward a copy of my letter of acknowledgment for recent distinction to her Majesty...

div.p: M69/27, unit 25, VPRS 1096 inward correspondence, VA 466 Governor, Public Record Office, Victoria.

It is very kind of you, dear Mr Manners-Sutton, to inform me of his Excellency's friendly intention, to forward a copy of my letter of acknowledgment for recent distinction to her Majesty's Home Government.

Anticipating the Governor's concurrence in my adressing the Duke of Buckingham I took the liberty of forwarding this morning a letter to his Grace with such other letters, which his Excellency allows me monthly to send through your Office.

Pray express to Sir Henry
identify?
my best thanks for all consideration shown me, as I must mainly a[i]scribe
what is this extra letter?
to his Excellency's condescending favor, that the new honor was so auspiciously conferred on me. Should H.R.H.
Alfred, Duke of Edinburgh. feel pleasure to visit also during his stay among us this time the Garden, I would feel greatly indebted, if I had private information a day before, with a view of avoiding the possibility of being away from the ground to receive the Prince.
